algorithm_technique: Hash map for value-to-coordinate lookup and counters for rows/columns
problem_summary_simple: Find the earliest move to completely paint a row or column in a matrix.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a hash map to store value-to-coordinate mappings and arrays to count painted cells per row/column, returning the index of the first number that completes a row/column.
key_insights: The problem requires efficiently tracking which cells are painted and checking if any row or column becomes fully painted after each move.
A hash map (`lookup`) is used to quickly find the row and column index for any given number from `arr`.
Two arrays, `row` and `col`, are used to maintain counts of painted cells for each row and column, respectively.
